column2: Her voice was soft, but her words rang like a drum. Word of a prophet who has directly spoken to our ancestors have spread to us. She speaks of the return of of our ancestors to the mortal realm and the enlightenment of our people. The words of this young girl have penetrated the minds of our people. If we are to accept her ideas, our people would be pleased, but if we were to ignore, our people would be engraged.
Word has spread of a Xhosa prophet. Most have rejected her ideas, and feel threatened by the radicalized nation on our borders.
There has been a heightened interest in learning and creating among our people thanks to the prophet's relentless teachings.

A band of warriors have crossed into Zulu territory and have stolen a large amount of cattle in the name of the prophet. She has stated that she never told them to do so, but doesn't condemn their actions. We are yet to receive a Zulu response.
This can only be good for our people.
The Xhosa have cross the border and stole our cattle. We must take immediate action.
This is unacceptable. We will take back what is ours!

The wedding had been planned for months. Some people opposed the idea of King Sandile marrying the prophet, calling it a simple power grab, while the chief states tthat it was the prophet's idea in the first place. Despite the protests, the ceremony was grand. The feast had lasted for hours. The marriage between the prophet and the King had cemented the new beliefs of our people.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was childless, so our people have looked at the prophet for leadership, which she, in her grace, has accepted. This could be a silver lining for our people.

1000 cattle were gathered for slaughter. Weeping could be heard from peak to peak. The prophet is dead. Her health had been waning, but we weren't expect such a sudden death. We shall mourn her for decades.
The prophet has suggested that we conquer the Zulu and teach them her ways, and why shouldn't we? It will be done

Her health is waning. If we are to continue her teachings, we need to adopt new methods of teaching. Our scholars have already learnt themselves in the Scot's script. If we were to translate it to our language, our ability to teach our youth would greatly increase.
The governing systems of old aren't sustainable for a country of our size. The prophet, in her grace, has planned out a new administration that can handle the size of our nation.
Our conquests will not stop at Zulu. We shall unite all Mzansi under our teachings.
One does not achieve greatness by pretending to be great. We have united the South under our teachings. May we be eternal. Umzansi ungunaphakade!
We are surrounded by lands that are ripe for the taking, and filled with people that would be happy under our control. We must claim these areas.

We have been contacted by members of the liberation movement of Tsonga, currently living under the dominion of a neighboring country. There is an opportunity to stir up sentiment among those living there so that they may rise up and weaken our enemy. There is, of course, a risk that our efforts could be discovered and bring war down upon us.

We have been contacted by members of the liberation movement of Arbota, currently living under the dominion of a neighboring country. There is an opportunity to stir up sentiment among those living there so that they may rise up and weaken our enemy. There is, of course, a risk that our efforts could be discovered and bring war down upon us.
We hold provinces that Tsonga has claims on. Returning these provinces, as an act of good faith, would surely bolster our relations.
We hold provinces that Arbota has claims on. Returning these provinces, as an act of good faith, would surely bolster our relations.

The death of Fanomezantsoa, the chief of Arbota, made his fragile chiefdom descend in a spiral of chaos as his sons, Mzila and Mawewe, fight for the throne. Soshangane's armies, that once overran the Portuguese settlements at Delagoa Bay, Inhambane and Sena, now turn their gaze inwards as the chiefdom slowly edges towards civil war. It goes without saying that this represents an optimal opportunity to take some of these lands back, and several individuals in the colonies already began to take advantage of this situation.
We have been divided by our political differences, but now, we shall reunite under one banner. Ours.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was childless, leaving many to claim the Xhosa throne. Three main factions have arisen. The Rharhabe, the current ruling faction, who have put the chief's favoured wife, the queen regent, in power. The Gcaleka, the main opposition to the Rulers. They claim that the Rharhabe have been too soft on the foreigners, and that the Rharhabe are too weak to bring Xhosa to greatness. The Ndlambe. The weakest of the three, supported by those who wish for Xhosa to change with the world around it, instead of remainig a backwater.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was the greatest ruler in our history. Our future rulers have big shoes to fill.
The queen regent has failed to keep Xhosa society together. Local Rulers have pledged loyalties to different factions. The Rharhabe rule has ended.
I want to play as the Rharhabe!
I want to play as the Gcaleka!
I want to play as the Ndlambe!

Rubha Ùr is under our control. Now is the time to sit down with our former colonial masters at Neamhnaid, a town known for its beautiful views (which will, hopefully, distract their diplomats), and work out a peace deal that will see it transferred into Datiach hands.
We have retaken New Rubha from the Datiach. It is time to restore our old colony.
Recently, fighting has broken out between our garrisons in the colony and the Datiach, the mixed race people of New Rubha.

The situation in New Rubha has grown to a serious problem. A group of Datiach rebels have stormed the colonial office in Heidtoun and have sent us a list of ridiculous demands, including full independence and guarantees to not return to the colony.
Surely we can negotiate a settlement that everyone can agree with?
We shall stomp this rebellion before ideas of independence in our other colonial dominions spread!
What will we tell the Datiach?
They will gain equal rights with as the Scots in New Rubha.
They will be allowed to return to their normal lives under our rule.
The Datiach rebels have conceded in the negotiations. Life shall return to normal in New Rubha
The Datiach rebels have agreed to our terms. Peace shall be restored to the colony.

The Datiach have demanded our surrender, and, truth is, we can't deny it. They have held Heidtoun against our forces. This war has been an embarrassment on the world stage. Our best bet is to attempt to rekindle relations with the Datiach and create an ally out of them. We could also denounce the Datiach and try to retake Rubha Ùr.

The Datiach rebels of Rubha Ùr have embarrassed the Scots. They have forced them to sign the Treaty of Neamhnaid, securing Datiach independence. From now on, the stability of the Scottish Colonial Empire isn't guarenteed.
The Scots have lost Rubha Ùr to Datiach rebels. The colony revolted against their rule and have forced a peace with the Scots.
The Scots have lost Rubha Ùr to Datiach rebels.
We should rekindle relations with the Datiach.
We should attempt to retake New Rubha.
We have achieved victory over the Scots. They have accepted our terms, and they seem to be attempting to rekindle relations with us. Perhaps they could become a useful ally in future.

We have achieved victory over the Scots. They have reluctantly accepted our terms. This does not mean that our independence is guarenteed, however. We must remain vigilant for future incursions if we wish to keep of freedom.
The Low German merchants of Heidtoun are syphoning funds from our Eastern colonies, away from our treasury.
With the construction of the Suez Canal, the Merchants of Heidtoun have become increasingly irrelevant. It seems that the solution to this issue was simply patience.
It all seems to have worked out!
We have inherited New Rubha's owner's problems with the Rubhach-German Merchants. They will syphon our funds from the trade routes between East and West.
What are we to do with the Merchants?
Bar their companies from the port. Of course, they will be compensated  accordingly.
Nationalize their companies, they have stolen enough from us.
Those bastards will pay for their crimes against us.
The Rubhach-German Merchants have long stolen our country's wealth from the trade between east and west. It is time to discuss what we shall do with the Merchants.

With the introduction of European and Columbian crops and farming methods, and the sparse amount of people, the population of Southern Africa has begun to explode. We are yet to see how this will effect the region, but this could open many oppurtunites for us.
Our old prophet has led us down this path. We must complete it. We shall break the boundries between the heavens.
The Xhosa and us have ended our petty squabbles. It is time to stand united against the Zulu.
And we'll bask in glory, victory or not.
The Tsonga and us have ended our petty squabbles. It is time to stand united against the Zulu.
And we'll bask in glory, victory or not.
The time for war has come. We have prepared what we can, but we can prepare no longer. The longer we wait, the stronger, more consolidated the Zulu become. We have to attack now.
Perhaps war isn't the right option...
We have lost. We are humiliated. But we will return. Aphile maZulu!.
We have lost, and our future is uncertain, but we still remain. They have been leniant on us, and they will regret it.
The Arbotsy living in our land have revolted under their deposed king. We suspect that the Pedi are behind this.
They have marched on our villages. they have taken our cattle. We are defeated. But we will return, one day.
Our subjects our revolting, our soldiers are deserting and furthur the Zulu have marched. We have lost.
We have bested the Bapedi and their sly tools. Our neighbours, and the Scots, see our might. IKwaZulu iyabusa!

The rise of the Zulu may have given us our freedom against our Ndebele oppressors, but their continued existance is a threat to our freedom. If we are to survive, we must act, and we shouldn't act alone.
I can think of many who would fight against the Zulu.
The Arbota have lost their freedom at home, but  we can win it for them in Manjakazi. Their remaining forces are weak, and will need supplies, but their numbers and desperation could prove useful.
The Xhosa have long been rivals of the Zulu. They lay claim to their southern lands, now could be their oppurtunity for victory.
The Tsonga are currently facing internal strife and divison. A victory against the most powerful army in the region could bring the unity they desire.
The Arbota have accepted our proposal, but time will tell if they stick to their part of the deal.
The Bapedi have invited us to a coalition against the Zulu, with the promise of eThekwini as a reward. What should we respond with?
The Xhosa have accepted to the proposal. Our coalition grows greater.
The Xhosa have refused our offer. It seems that our battle will be more difficult.
The Bapedi have invited us to a coalition against the Zulu, with the promise of Tsaneng and Manjakazi as a reward. What should we respond with?
The Tsonga have accepted to the proposal. Our coalition grows greater.
The Tsonga have refused our offer. It seems that our battle will be more difficult.

We are tactically inferior to the Zulu, but we have the advantage of the Scots and their weaponry. It's clear that they want a weak Zululand, and a weak Zululand is what we'll give them, if they accept our offer.
The Scottish are more experienced with their guns than we are. It's a great, yet expensive idea to hire their mercenaries as generals.
It is time for our subjects pass the folds to be integrated into our country proper.
With our control of the lands of Rubha Ùr, we can name it accordingly.
With our control of the lands of Xirikwa, we can name it accordingly.
With our control of Rinn, we can name it accordingly.
The coalition war against the Zulu has started.

The Xhosa scum has been beaten for good. After Hibernian intervention on our side, the heathen Xhosa king, quickly overwhelmed by our combined forces has unconditionally surrendered to us. Total victory has been achieved and the Xhosas will no longer endanger either us or the Fenians!

The Xhosa have been no match for the combined forces of ours and Drummond. As promised territorial concessions have been granted to us and a sense of calm has been restored. With this the future of our young nation must be decided.

The Xhosa war has concluded and our young nation has entered a time of relative peace, although with its future uncertain. Thus, representatives of the Pharlaimint have met in Conchobar to discuss the future of our nation. Many vital questions and choices are at stake so we must choose carefully.

One of the first issues to be discussed at the meeting were social reforms. One half of the representatives advocated for implementation of an education system, pointing out that for a nation to develop it's citizens need to be well educated. The other half advocated for better health coverage, pointing out that a modern nation cannot function properly without providing basic medical treatment to all citizens. While there was a substantial group of representatives advocating for both, the issue at stake were funds so therefore it was decided that...

Although of Scottish descent, the Drummonders have always been friendly with us throughout our short history. Having allied against the Xhosa during the Frontier War, some of our representatives, called Oceaniates, advocated for further cooperation. They proposed an idea yet unheard of, an utopian like nation state of Caledonian Scots and Fenians where all can prosper based on the fundamental idea of liberty. The groundwork has already started being layed and it's on the Pharlaimint to decide the course of action.
We must realize the Oceanian Dream!

As the last point of discussion the representatives discussed the matters of governance. Throughout our short history we've been ruled by the de facto "president" and general Cathaoir Murchu with unlimited power. It was a temporary solution in order for the state to survive in a harsh environment although this is no longer the case. Now we are able to write a new constitution and install a true democracy while simultaneously attracting european settlers to our free nation!
We have managed to beat Drummond in the short term, perhaps it would be best to bail out now and not risk further escalation.
No, we will seize this oppurtunity for complete victory!

Our republic, born out of pioneers brave enough to venture into the unknown, brave enough to face the hardships of leaving what we know, into the isolation of our new home, brave enough to face those who might tread on our independence. Our border to the east has always been one of tension and unease, defined by the Great Kariega, but our hand has been forced, and to war we must go. It is of greatest importance to our survival that we beat the Xhosa and their heathen king, but under the leadership of our great president, Morven Stewart, we shall succeed.
We have achieved total victory in Drummond. Now is the time for celebration!
We have achieved total victory in Qariega. Now is the time for celebration!
The Drummonder Republic is of our creation, and it is time for them to return. We must send an ultimatum to them, demanding annexation.
We have consolidated our strength, and now we are finally able to expand to our rightfull land in the north.

The highly controversial matter in Rubha Ùr regarding our integration into the scottish colony has sparked serious outrage. Local militias such as the "Caledonian Front" started organising and causing chaos in the colony yearning for an independent Caledonia. Today, a few weeks later, the powers in Heidtoun have sent an outrageous demand of our annexation to the New Rubha colony. We won't tolerate this and shall therefore fight for a free Caledonia!
The damned cattlemen and their dastardly president have refused annexation! We will act accordingly!
The powers in Heidtoun have demanded our annexation to them. How should we respond!
Of course, it is our duty!
Those rotten herders have refused annexation! We will act accordingly!
Tsonga has been built on lies and empty promises that we are unable to fulfill, and we are starting to face the consequences of this.
The Kariban bandits in our north have made life difficult for both our soldiers and civilians.
The Foreign powers in Heidtoun and Tananarive are meddling with our markets and politics.
Our leaders see the pointlessness of working at their full competence, as we are unable to supply them with sufficient rewards.

The Second Vatsonga Empire, as it has been called, has little to do with the Tsonga of old, which are all but extinct and assimilated into the modern Tsonga population. The empire has been built in less than a decade, not because of its impressive military, great leadership, or strong economy. It was built by the desperation of its people, being surrounded on all sides by powerful enemies, with no unity, being fed lies by an ambitious clan who happened to be in the right place at the right time. But now, the empire of empty promises is facing the consequences of its actions. It has no proper systems to gain wealth from its people, no methods of dealing with the new waves of bantus, no ways of dealing with foreign powers meddling with its politics, and no ways of paying its leaders their fair due. We must act fast if Tsonga is to survive, or we will simply be a distant memory of a worse time.
Noma a we taleriwi hi nambu.

The Kariban bandits in the north have harassed us for far too long, we must put an end to this. We will use all means available to stop these scum. §RYou must keep all units in the listed provinces, and keep funding up, for at most, 1 year. Otherwise, the pacification will fail, and you'll have to start again.
We have managed to pacify the bandits in the north. One step closer to a stable Tsonga.
Due to the lack of persistent effort against the bandits, they have reasserted control in the north.

Our leadership is in a sorry state. We need to invest in our leadership structures. We will succeed, no matter how much it costs. §GYou must have 10% civilization progress, NOT 50%, to take this decision.
We must prepare to reclaim diplomatic independence from the Scots and Imerina, whether through hard or soft power.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Imerina have long been our main rival, and have used any method to weaken us. We must stop this.
We have managed to achieve diplomatic independence. Now is the time to celebrate!
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
With our efforts in solving the major causes that have stopped us from fulfilling our promises to our people and chiefs, we can now give our people what they deserve. This will cost, however.

The tensions between us and our minor chiefs has grown too great to manage. At this point, every village has their own claimant to the Tsonga legacy. Peaceful consolidation is now seemingly impossible, best we can do now is prepare for war.
War has come. Thie chief of Zumbo has risen up against our rule, supported by the Scots, and more are likely to follow. Tsonga has fallen, but it will rise once more.
The current dynasty lives on! §GKariba can also be chosen through this path.
Bulawayo seems nice this time of year.
Our Tsonga overlords have collapsed under their own weight. It is time for Mthwakazi to chose its own destiny.
We will not abandon our roots!
The bandits in our north have revolted, we are yet to know their motives, but this can't be good for us.
The region of Hwange has revolted under the Kariban banner.
Kariba is at a crossroad. We could either claim rulership of the Tsonga, or we could stick to our roots, and revolt for our people. What should we do?
The Tsonga throne will be ours!
Our brothers across the rivers have joined our cause! We will be victorius!
Intervene in the Tsonga civil war
The Tsonga civil war presents an oppurtunity for expansion. Should we take it?
With our conquest of the Miyalan homeland, their king has fled past the lake.
We are in control of the core of Tsonga. It is time to take the mantle of the old empire.
We have grown in strength, and are now capable of expanding our confederation across the lake.
Word has spread of a Scot overstepping his boundries, spreading new ideas among us and our people. He should be of no worry, however.
The Mad Scot Attempts a Coup

The Mad Scot has arrived at the capital with a small brigade of Scottish infantry, and is attempting to take control of the country! The resoults of the skirmish will change the future of our country.
A monarch of any kind is too dangerous for the continuation of the Tsonga. A council of the king's advisers and regional elders should suffice for governence.
The civil war was bloody and devastating, but is over now. We must rebuild.
We must expand past the Zambezi to secure our northern position.
We must conquer Miyala to secure our position.
We must claim the land held by our Mifangaro brothers.
Drought, poor farming habits, or war have caused insufficient food supplies to feed our people.
A dried up old traveller has returned from the wilderness. When given a whiskey he says with a hoarse voice 'The mountains! They shine with unimaginable wealth!'
Kirkwood is on the outskirts of our control in New Rubha. It shouldn't be difficult to fully annex the region under our colonial administration.
Delahaye is a small town on the outskirts of what one would consider New Rubha. The people there would be glad if we were to annex the region and offer some protection.
The settlers north of Heidtoun have long been connected to the colony proper. It is time to fully integrate them.
Now that we have solidified control in Mongu, we can annex Mavinga.
With ever-growing powers all around the region, it has become increasingly obvious that our brothers in the north would be more than happy to cooperate with us, securing their freedom.
The Mifangaro, while different in many ways, are still malagasy. We should come to recognize this.
Our elders and advisers have suggested that we send a gift to another country. This could be an oppurtunity for an alliance.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent us large sums of wealth, in hopes of improving relations.
Our elders and advisers have shone resentment towards another people. Perhaps we should show them how we feel?
The bastards in $FROMCOUNTRY$ have insulted us and our people.
Our warriors are begging to invade another country, and receive tribute. Should we allow them?
$PROVINCENAME$ has been lucky with our harvests this year. We can expect higher birth rates and much lower death rates in the region for the following months.
$PROVINCENAME$ has been unlucky with harvests this year. We can expect starvation and death in the region for this following months.
There has been recent debate between our advisers as to how our surplus resources should be spent. What should we decide upon?
European Traders have entered our land have offered to sell as munitions, for a hefty price. Do we accept?
With almost no resistence, the north has been occupied.
With the annexation of the Batswana core, the remaining leaders have fled north and have re-established A Tswana Kingdom.

The Senque river shows prime conquering potential. The region is in chaos due to the incoming settlers, with no strong central authority. The logistics of the conquest and maintenance will be difficult, but managable.
We must first occupy the region before integrating it. This can be easily achieved, but still, must be achieved.
The Khoikhoi are in dire need of our guidance in this ever-changing world. We must conquer and integrate the land before any other powers get to.
The Sotho, Pedi and Tswana have much in common, both in language and in foreign threats. It would be best if we were to unite under one ruler. Ours.
Coastal Zululand has the perfect climate for growing sugar, and plenty of labour. It would be foolish not to import the crop immediately.

With the large sugar plantations, and reports of coal in the mountains, $CAPITAL$ would be a perfect location for a rum distillery. This will not only bring profit, but will also help with the modernisation of the region.

Litema, also spelled as ditema, is a form of Sotho mural art composed of decorative and symbolic geometric patterns, commonly associated with Sesotho and Sepedi tradition practised in Basotho and Bapedi. Women create litema on the outer walls and inside of homes by means of engraving, painting, relief mouldings and mosaic. Typically, the geometric patterns are combed or scratched into the wet top layer of fresh clay and dung plaster of the wall, and later painted with earth ochers. Patterns most often mimic ploughed fields through a combed texture, or the patterns refer to plant life, and more occasionally to other aspects of the natural world, such as referring to a clan totem animal. It is common for women of an entire village to apply litema on such special occasions as a wedding or a religious ceremony.
As we no longer neighbour our overlord, it will be easy to declare independence.

The change has been gradual, but noticeable. Litema mural art has evolved past the point of showing just vague concepts, such as marriage or birth, but is now being used to tally crop yields and weapons, display stories and conversations, and even tell jokes. Litema, at least for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$, is not just an art form, it is a syllabary. How this will effect our future, we are yet to know, but it can only be positive.

The newly-developed syllabry greatly suits our language and needs, and it is somewhat recognizable to our people. It would be logical to adopt it as fast as possible. §RFirst civilization progress is 5%, second 10%, third 15%

The Hinterlands of Southern Africa possess a mild climate, and has reports of mountains of valueable resources. Scotland is lacking in settler colonies. Our people are emigrating to Columbia, and so are no longer providing to us. This problem can be partially solved, and the resources easily harvested, if we were to establish a settler colony.

The south-eastern coast of Southern Africa are a prime target for a new settler colony. The climate is mild, The mountains and soils rich with resources, and the natives are subdued. Our people are itching for a new frontier, and we will give it to them.
Now that we are in control of Transgrey, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Trasliath, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Limpopo, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Lochnagar, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Lochlainn, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Basutoland, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Moray, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Móire, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Inner Bechuanaland, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Dingwall, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Damhnait, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Outer Bechuanaland, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Clelland, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of iKwaNatali, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of New Lothian, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Xhosaland, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Hirselhaven, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Cúchulainn, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Zululand, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Transgrey, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Trasliath, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Limpopo, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Qariega, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Cariga, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Ceathairga, we can rename it.
The colony of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ New Rubha has asked to be governed as an autonomous dominion within the empire.

In 1895, Hector Stewart introduced in the parliament of $COUNTRY$, a motion to create the game reserve which would become the Stewart National Park. That motion, introduced together with another parliament member by the name of R. K. Loveday, and accepted for discussion in September 1895 by a majority of one vote, resulted in the proclamation by Edwards Campbell, prime minister of Ostiralia, on 26 March 1898, of a "Government Wildlife Park." This park would later be known as the Sabi Game Reserve and was expanded into the Stewart National Park in 1926.
Creating New Rubha under an independent government, as a puppet to our nation, will make for a much stronger ally.

We pray for the blissen o The Awmichtie.'\n\n'The Vice o Caledonia', although it gained official status as Caledonia's national anthem only in 1938 had, for a long time prior, been unofficially used in that capacity. Originally written as a poem by Grenald McAllistor in 1910, the piece had music composed for it in 1911 by Murphy de Villiers. 'The Vice' saw frequent use in the broadcasts of the Caledonian Broadcasting Company, which played it at the end of daily broadcasts, along with God Save the King. Adopt 'The Vice', and let us give our young country a proper anthem!
The colony of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Ostiralia has asked to be governed as an autonomous dominion within the empire.
The colony of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Murcadia has asked to be governed as an autonomous dominion within the empire.
Creating Ostiralia under an independent government, as a puppet to our nation, will make for a much stronger ally.
Creating Murcadia under an independent government, as a puppet to our nation, will make for a much stronger ally.

With the population of Hirselhaven rapidly growing, easily arable land is becoming sparse. It would be greatly beneficial to the continued settlement of the region for us to help clear some unusable terrain to make it more suitable for farming.

With the population of Cúchulainn rapidly growing, easily arable land is becoming sparse. It would be greatly beneficial to the continued settlement of the region for us to help clear some unusable terrain to make it more suitable for farming.

Monarchism has proven effective in Europe, remaining stable for thousands of years. It is far too dangerous for us to stray away from this system. Morven Stewart has proven to be a competent temporary leader making him the perfect candidate for a monarch.

Caledonia must style itself after the liberal democracies of Columbia, both for the liberty of its people and the continuation of the state. We are low in numbers and surrounded by enemies, it must be appealing for the discontent people of Europe to come here to establish a new life in a free land instead of doing so in Columbia. A new constitution is to be written and a true nation state will be established.

The Drummonders, fearing for their national integrity, have approached us for help. President of Drummond Morven Stewart, offered us Xhosa frontier lands if we were to come to their aid. Naturally, in order to eliminate a mutual threat we must aid Stewart and to war we must go. The Xhosa scum must be defeated at all cost!
It's a long, long way to Bisho...
Bisho is in ruins as the advancing coalition of Fenian and Drummonder forces keep ravaging the Xhosa lands. Seeing no other choice, the heathen Xhosa king will surely unconditionally surrender to us.
Now that we are in control of Aileach we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Odhráin we can rename it.

We have managed to quickly overwhelm the scottish colonial garrisons in Rubha Ùr and seize the colony. The colonial capital of Heidtoun has been occupied for months now, with no sight of a scottish force arriving to recapture the colony. We can thus force Scotland to the negotiating table.

The Drummonders, rejecting integration, have proven far more resilient than we ever would have thought possible. Now we face the humiliating prospect of surrendering Rubha Ùr to them. It seems we have little choice, with the war going so badly and Heidtoun already occupied. All we can do is decide whether we will pursue a conciliatory path with Drummond and perhaps make them future allies or aim at returning in the future and reclaiming what has been lost.
Let us reconcile, they're of our kin after all!
Never! All of Caledonia shall be ours!

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent negotiators to work out the terms of their surrender. The tone is one of reconciliation, and it is clear the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ wish to build good relations with us after the business of this war is done.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent negotiators to work out the terms of their surrender. The tone of the talks has been very bitter, and it's clear the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government will do all it can to return and trouble us again in the future.
We shall accept their surrender nevertheless.

With the Scottish colonial administration ousted, the fate of Rubha Ùr is cemented under Drummonder rule. Therefore we shall proclaim the creation of Caledonia, for no longer are we just a puny rebellious group of pioneers!

The three crown colonies of New Rubha, Ostiralia and Murcadia have been developed enough and shall therefore be reorganised into the Dominion of Caledonia. This will allow for better development and growth of our colonies in the southern tip of Africa.

Tensions have recently been rising between us and Drummond ever since their victory in Rubha Ùr and an incident has recently broken out on our border. One of our militias, called "The Patrick's Legion" crossed the border into Drummond at midnight, raiding and plundering the border settlement of Fauldin. A few locals were reported dead with the settlement almost fully destroyed. The Drummonder Government is still yet to respond to the incident but we know for sure they won't be happy about this.
Formed in the wake of rising tensions with Drummond, the Patricks Legion is an elite military regiment in Hibernia influencing the rest of the army with its tactics.

At midnight it came, with nobody expecting it, for what was supposed to be a regular night for the Fauldiners turned into hell on Earth... coming from the east, it approached, a group of infamous Fenian militia. The group nicknamed "The Patrick's Legion" raided the small border settlement of Fauldin with their intentions unclear. In the morning, the few who survived had vacated the settlement which was at this point fully destroyed, with many dead piled up outside. This seems like something that would happen in a horror story but that night, it came into reality. This is obviously unnaceptable, therefore we must act upon it somehow!
Simply ask for trial of the Legion and reparations

Seeing no other way of dealing with the issue, the Drummonders have declared war with aims of our complete subjugation. Thus begins the great fight for survival. We must win this war by any means necessary otherwise we shall find ourselves enslaved yet again!
Drummond requests trial of the Legion

Not much to our surprise the government of Drummond was outraged at the actions of our men. They request of us to turn over the Legion members for trial in Drummond and pay reparations for the damages caused in the raid. Either that or we risk further escalation, potentially leading to conflict.
We will abide by their demands
Let them come if they dare!
The Fenians fearing war over actions of the Patrick's legion have conceded to us. Reparations for the Fauldin raid have been paid out and the Legion members turned over to us for trial.

For the Fenians, the reasonable demands we asked of them were deemed too much. This is outrageous! The one chance at redemption we have given them has proven pointless as they clearly have no understanding. Therefore we shall deal with them for once and for all!

Territories encompassing the Scottish Cape Colony and Drummond were the first areas of Fenian settlement. Many hardships were endured under the colonial administration which lead to Fenian trekking eastward. With a great part of our population still remaining in the Rinn it is our right to free them.

Our group of hardy pioneers, in search of a new homeland, has well adjusted to it's new home. The sons of Ireland have against all odds forged a great nation in the southern tip of Africa and are ready to pursue greater goals. We shall reclaim our birthright and free all Irishmen under foreign oppression!
The birthright of all Fenian is no more occupied by oppressors. We have freed Ireland, after a long journey up north from Hibernia. No longer will the Irishmen be opressed! Fada beo Éire!
Now that we are in control of Findargat we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Transgorits we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Mt Weddell, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Ailinne, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Thaba Bosiu, we can rename it.

It is the destiny of our people to achieve dominion over the fertile lands of southern Africa. Our nation grows ever larger and more prosperous, but we lack a critical resource: manpower. We shall invite migrants to settle the frontiers, in the spirit of our heritage.

There are several major cities which can rightly claim to be the heart of our nation. Is it Heidtoun, where the colonial capital used to be? Drummond, one of the first settlements of the Caledonian trekkers and the current capital? Or the quickly-growing Fenian city of the east Corbenic? Whichever we choose, large construction projects and improvement of infrastructure are sure to follow.

There are several major cities which can rightly claim to be the heart of our nation. Is it Heidtoun, where the first europeans arrived? Drummond, one of the first settlements of the Caledonian trekkers which also stands at the crossroads of Caledonian and Fenian culture? Or the current capital, the city of Conchobar, founded by Fenian trekkers from New Rubha? Whichever we choose, large construction projects and improvement of infrastructure are sure to follow.
Now that we are in control of Carù, we can rename it.
Now that we are in control of Lumsden, we can rename it.

From the first settlements in the Rinn up to the great Limpopo river all shall be Fenian! Our ever growing nation, with new immigrants flocking in and a rapidly expanding industry needs access to new resources and lands for settlement. Pushing towards the Limpopo river would provide a natural boundary.
Hibernian resources and manpower are plentiful and shall therefore be directed towards the colonisation of the frontier north of our country!

Our past colonial overlords over in Scotland had great colonial ambitions in the southern tip of Africa. With our rule over New Rubha established and new immigrants flocking in we can start pursuing these ambitions. Firstly we shall push towards the Limpopo river, providing us with a natural boundary.
Caledonian resources and manpower are plentiful and shall therefore be directed towards the colonisation of the frontier north of our country!
The Outback has throughout it's history been a sparsely populated region in southern Africa. Considering it's strategic importance we should take steps towards establishing rule over it.
Now that we own the southern Outback we can introduce new names.
Now that we own the northern Outback we can introduce new names.

The war for Drummonder independence is over and we came out together as victors! Pharlaimint representatives in Concobhar have already laid the groundwork for unification before the war even began. Hence, we must now work out the groundwork's points with Drummond in order to write a new constitution and lay the foundations for unification.
The Hibernian delegation from Concobhar has arrived in Drummond in order to work out the points of their groundwork for unification. Accepting their demands will bring us closer towards union.

After writing a new constitution with Drummonder representatives while also uniting our finances and military we're just one thing short off being done. We shall meet once more in Drummond and together with their parliament pass the Act of Union, ratifying the unification of Oceania.

The Parliament of Oceania discussed the means of which the nation will expand for a lengthy time by now. Wanting to utilise the ever growing manpower and industrial might of Oceania, the Parliamentary representatives have thus put forth the Frontier Expansion Act. The act would lay claim to the lands reaching up to the Limpopo river and would allow for future occupation and settlement of the region.

Oceanian resources and manpower are plentiful and shall therefore be put to use. The Parliament of Oceania will therefore pass a bill allowing for colonisation and settlement of the frontier north of our country!

The Oceanian Parliament has already allowed for the settlement of the lands up north which have been succesfully colonised. Now a bill shall be passed which will lay claim to the strategically important northwestern Outback region and shall furthermore allow for additional northern settlement.

The Ellon valley situated on the northern coast of the Outback has very favorable terrain for settlement and development. If we are to direct more resources to it we can turn the valley into a valuable region for trade, serving as the first outposts for European merchants when they arrive in our nation.

The Union has asserted itself as a hegemon over the African continent and a highly important nation on the world stage. To further back this claim the Parliament of Oceania shall pass "The Last Expansion Act", laying claim to additional large swathes of land on the African continent. The goal of the act is to secure a large resource rich area for further settlement around the boundaries of the Zambezi river.

Ever since rumors of Heidtoun's plan to consolidate rule over Drummond broke out, anti-colonial sentiment started growing exponentially in the colony of Rubha Ùr. The local Scots no longer feel attached to the European colonial power which is now viewed as an exploiter by them. Local militias such as the "Caledonian Front" are springing up across the colony causing even more chaos and drawing the attention of Edinburgh. Everything is pointing towards a regional standoff and if we are to achieve our union with Drummond we must prepare for war with Scotland.
War will return, Sooner than we think
Though our government is situated well enough as it is, perhaps a new location would be more fitting for our new situation?
